intro: Silene chamarensis var. udocanica, commonly known as the Udoncanica catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its delicate, often pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Silene chamarensis var. udocanica is known for its short stature and is often found in high-altitude environments.
